timeline.body: Why is this added? It's not used...
timeline.bodyText: Why is this added? It's not used...
timeline.bodyHTML: Why is this added? It's not used...
timeline.author: Nightfirecat
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -460,6 +460,23 @@ public AsyncBufferedImage getImage(int itemId)
 	 * @param quantity
 	 * @return
 	 */
+	public AsyncBufferedImage getImage(int itemId, int quantity)

replies.bodyText: I had added it mostly to keep in line w/ how I've always done overloaded methods in Java (which is have the least qualified method call increasingly verbose methods w/ defaults) but there is no actual reason for it so I've removed this method overload.
replies.author: SirGirion

@@ -65,60 +71,68 @@ public Dimension render(Graphics2D graphics)
 		int runiteFound = session.getRuniteFound();
 
 		// If no ores have even been collected, don't bother showing anything
-		if (nuggetsFound == 0 && coalFound == 0 && goldFound == 0 && mithrilFound == 0
-			&& adamantiteFound == 0 && runiteFound == 0)

replies.bodyText: Good call, thought blast furnace showed all ores so that is why I did it this way but I missed the crucial if (count == 0) { continue; } in that overlay.
